trans-unit.source: Represents a System Access Control List (SACL).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> class with the specified values.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the new <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object is a container.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the new <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object is a directory object Access Control List (ACL).
The number of Access Control Entries (ACEs) this <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object can contain.
This number is to be used only as a hint.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> class with the specified values from the specified <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.RawAcl"></xref> object.
The Access Control Entries (ACEs) in the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.RawAcl> object are cloned.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the new <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object is a container.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the new <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object is a directory object Access Control List (ACL).
The underlying <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.RawAcl"></xref> object for the new <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object.
Specify <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> to create an empty ACL.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> class with the specified values.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the new <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object is a container.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the new <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object is a directory object Access Control List (ACL).
The revision level of the new <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object.
The number of Access Control Entries (ACEs) this <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object can contain.
This number is to be used only as a hint.
Adds an audit rule to the current <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object.
Adding an audit rule might cause one or more existing Access Control Entries (ACEs) to be combined.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to add an audit rule.
The <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAuditRule"></xref>for the new audit rule.
Adds an audit rule to the current <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object.
Adding an audit rule might cause one or more existing Access Control Entries (ACEs) to be combined.
The type of audit rule to add.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to add an audit rule.
The access mask for the new audit rule.
Flags that specify the inheritance properties of the new audit rule.
Flags that specify the inheritance propagation properties for the new audit rule.
Adds an audit rule with the specified settings to the current <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object.
Use this method for directory object Access Control Lists (ACLs) when specifying the object type or the inherited object type for the new audit rule.
The type of audit rule to add.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to add an audit rule.
The access mask for the new audit rule.
Flags that specify the inheritance properties of the new audit rule.
Flags that specify the inheritance propagation properties for the new audit rule.
Flags that specify if the `objectType` and `inheritedObjectType` parameters contain non-<xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> values.
The identity of the class of objects to which the new audit rule applies.
The identity of the class of child objects which can inherit the new audit rule.
Removes the specified audit rule from the current <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object.
Audit removal is accomplished by using a complex algorithm that might add ACEs in addition to removing them.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to remove an audit rule.
The <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAuditRule"></xref> for which to remove an audit rule.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this method successfully removes the specified audit rule; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Removes the specified audit rule from the current <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object.
Audit removal is accomplished by using a complex algorithm that might add ACEs in addition to removing them.
The type of audit rule to remove.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to remove an audit rule.
The access mask for the rule to be removed.
Flags that specify the inheritance properties of the rule to be removed.
Flags that specify the inheritance propagation properties for the rule to be removed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this method successfully removes the specified audit rule; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Removes the specified audit rule from the current <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl"></xref> object.
Use this method for directory object Access Control Lists (ACLs) when specifying the object type or the inherited object type.
Audit removal is accomplished by using a complex algorithm that might add ACEs in addition to removing them.
The type of audit rule to remove.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to remove an audit rule.
The access mask for the rule to be removed.
Flags that specify the inheritance properties of the rule to be removed.
Flags that specify the inheritance propagation properties for the rule to be removed.
Flags that specify if the `objectType` and `inheritedObjectType` parameters contain non-<xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> values.
The identity of the class of objects to which the removed audit control rule applies.
The identity of the class of child objects which can inherit the removed audit rule.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this method successfully removes the specified audit rule; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Removes the specified audit rule from the current <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.DiscretionaryAcl"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to remove an audit rule.
The <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAuditRule"></xref> for the rule to be removed.
Removes the specified audit rule from the current <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.DiscretionaryAcl"></xref> object.
The type of audit rule to remove.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to remove an audit rule.
The access mask for the rule to be removed.
Flags that specify the inheritance properties of the rule to be removed.
Flags that specify the inheritance propagation properties for the rule to be removed.
Removes the specified audit rule from the current <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.DiscretionaryAcl"></xref> object.
Use this method for directory object Access Control Lists (ACLs) when specifying the object type or the inherited object type.
The type of audit rule to remove.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to remove an audit rule.
The access mask for the rule to be removed.
Flags that specify the inheritance properties of the rule to be removed.
Flags that specify the inheritance propagation properties for the rule to be removed.
Flags that specify if the `objectType` and `inheritedObjectType` parameters contain non-<xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> values.
The identity of the class of objects to which the removed audit control rule applies.
The identity of the class of child objects which can inherit the removed audit rule.
Sets the specified audit rule for the specified <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to set an audit rule.
The <xref href="System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAuditRule"></xref>for which to set an audit rule.
Sets the specified audit rule for the specified <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> object.
This method removes all existing Access Control Entries (ACEs) that match both specified <xref:System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier> object and the specified audit condition.
The audit condition to set.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to set an audit rule.
The access mask for the new audit rule.
Flags that specify the inheritance properties of the new audit rule.
Flags that specify the inheritance propagation properties for the new audit rule.
Sets the specified audit rule for the specified <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> object.
Use this method for directory object Access Control Lists (ACLs) when specifying the object type or the inherited object type.
This method removes all existing Access Control Entries (ACEs) that match both specified <xref:System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier> object and the specified audit condition.
The audit condition to set.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for which to set an audit rule.
The access mask for the new audit rule.
Flags that specify the inheritance properties of the new audit rule.
Flags that specify the inheritance propagation properties for the new audit rule.
Flags that specify if the `objectType` and `inheritedObjectType` parameters contain non-<xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> values.
The identity of the class of objects to which the new audit rule applies.
The identity of the class of child objects which can inherit the new audit rule.
